item.description:
This will be the 3rd time we try this!  I'm sure the weather will cooperate this time...

NH2MeKA - Paddle from Dover, New Hampshire to South Berwick, Maine along very serene stretches of two different rivers.

Meet in Dover to unload boats and shuttle cars to the take out in Maine (10 mins away by car) .

We'll paddle three miles down one river and 5 miles up another river, riding both the outgoing and incoming tides the whole way.

There will be a stop for a rest and a snack at an historic 18th-century home with beautiful flower gardens and fields.  We can stretch our legs, smell the flowers, and enjoy the views from this beautifully preserved four-chimney home. (See photo. Tours available.)

Then, we'll continue up river past an old dam, an organic dairy farm, and up to a large waterfall, where we'll end our journey.

Last seen along this route: bald eagles soaring, kingfishers fishing, mink & ground hogs scampering, minnows jumping, stripers striping, and only one small motor boat on the entire trip.  These sections of both rivers are very shallow and almost no other humans will be on them.

After our trip we can buy milk, cheese, meat and produce at the organic dairy farm and head back to Dover for outdoor drinks and food.

One rental kayak is available. (Sorry, the kayak is taken.) Email Larry for info.

*This trip depends upon everyone being slightly more organized than usual... Please prepare your gear before you arrive.  If you arrive late, you can skip the shuttle & leave your car at the launch but you'll need to get a ride back to pick it up at the end.

10:30am unload boats/shuttle cars

11:30am: launch in New Hampshire

3pm: take out in Maine

Optional: 3:30-4pm Stop at a local Organic Farm

4-6pm: the eating and drinking @ the FARM BAR & GRILLE

NOTE:  I reserve the right to change the hour and location of this trip within a reasonable time/distance if weather or other conditions indicate.

(Also Note: Sandy & Cassandra will be presented with the fist annual NH2MeKA tenacity award at the completion of the actual NH to Me paddle - should it ever occur.)

Liability Release

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.

As organizer I make no claims regarding any expertise for this outing.   Fee is for meetup site expenses and planning.  This is not a guided tour.   I reserve the right to change the time and location of this trip within a reasonable amount if weather or other conditions indicate. - Larry Pilla
item.how_to_find_us: Turn just past the Farm Grille entrance @ the gravel drive in front of a wooden garage
item.name: 1st Annual New Hampshire to Maine Kayak Adventure
